newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's colonial legislature ends final session.
newsitem.headline: HK's colonial legislature ends final session.

text.p: HONG KONG, June 28 (REUTER) - Hong Kong's colonial legislature ended its final session on Saturday after a marathon 23 hour sitting which included debate and valedictory speeches laced with snatches of song and verse.
Hong Kong reverts to China from British rule at midnight on June 30. The territory's elected Legislative Council will be replaced within hours by a Provisional Legislature appointed by Beijing.
"The King is dead, long live the King," Legislative Council President Andrew Wong told Reuters during a break in the session. "Life must go on in Hong Kong and it will."
A total of 27 members of the 60-seat Legislative Council -- many of them democracy activists -- have not been appointed by Beijing to the new Provisional Legislature.
